name: ESP32 TCP/IP Van Controller
description: Designed and built a microcontroller-based system using an ESP32 in WAP mode to control van locks, windows, and radio via Wi-Fi and solid state relays over a custom encrypted private network web interface.
notes: Used ESP32 in WAP mode to host a secure control panel accessible via mobile devices.
Controlled van locks, windows, and radio using solid state relays driven by GPIO.
Implemented custom encrypted communication over a private Wi-Fi network.
Designed and hand-etched a custom PCB using ferric chloride and copper-clad substrate.
Optimized circuit pathing for reliable signal delivery in a mobile environment.
Integrated relay switching logic with web interface for real-time hardware control.

name: Guitar-Mounted MIDI Control Overlay
description: Built a custom guitar-mounted MIDI controller using a microcontroller and pressure-sensitive potentiometers to trigger sounds and control effects while playing. The system was mounted as a physical overlay and communicated as a standard MIDI device.
notes: Cut and fabricated a physical overlay to mount on the guitar body for tactile interaction.
Programmed a microcontroller to act as a class-compliant USB MIDI device.
Integrated pressure-sensitive potentiometers positioned for access during guitar playing.
Mapped analog input from sensors to trigger MIDI notes and CC values for real-time effects control.
Designed for ergonomic use during live play, enabling expressive control of effects chains and instruments.
Created custom sensor thresholds to differentiate between pressure levels and gestures.

name: BLE-Controlled RGB Strip with Custom PCB
description: Designed and fabricated a custom 4-channel MOSFET control PCB using ferric chloride and copper-clad board, enabling BLE-based control of a 12V RGB LED strip.
notes: Etched a custom PCB using ferric chloride on copper-clad substrate for clean, functional routing.
Designed a 4-channel MOSFET switching circuit to control 3 RGB channels and one auxiliary output.
Integrated a BLE module to receive wireless control input via mobile device or external trigger.
Matched logic-level inputs with MOSFET gate requirements for consistent switching at 12V.
Used onboard headers and terminals for clean integration with external LED strip and power supply.
Explored durability and thermal characteristics of the board under continuous RGB fading cycles.

name: Custom Lily58 Split Keyboard Build
description: Built a fully hand assembled Lily58 split mechanical keyboard from a bare PCB—soldering 116 tiny SMD diodes, switches, USB C & TRRS jacks, and an nRF52840 microcontroller; bootloaded and flashed custom ZMK firmware; crafted multi layer keymaps and macros; and developed a React/WebSocket front end to visualize real time keypresses and available keys per layer, accelerating muscle memory training.
notes: Cleaned and prepped the bare Lily58 PCB with flux for optimal solder flow.
Hand soldered 116 tiny SMD diodes with correct polarity to establish the key matrix.
Installed and soldered mechanical switches, USB C & TRRS jacks, and the nRF52840 MCU module.
Bootloaded the nRF52840 using SWD and flashed custom ZMK firmware via UF2.
Authored ZMK keymap configs defining QWERTY, symbol, navigation, and numpad layers with macros.
Tested and fine tuned macros in firmware to ensure reliable multi key sequences.
Built a WebSocket app with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to stream and display real time key events and layer availability.
Added UI overlays and tooltips to highlight active layers and guide muscle memory training.

name: Custom Hydroponic Hot Pepper LED Grow Light
description: Designed and assembled a bespoke LED grow light on a stock aluminum heatsink—hand mounting monochromatic diodes and high power Cree COB modules, calculating and sizing constant current drivers, soldering heavy gauge wiring, and optimizing thermal management for indoor hydroponic hot pepper cultivation.
skills: Cree COB and Monochromatic LED Integration
notes: Machined and drilled a stock aluminum heatsink to accommodate LED star boards and COB modules.
Selected and configured constant current drivers based on calculated forward voltage and current requirements.
Hand soldered Cree COB LEDs and discrete monochromatic diodes onto heavy copper star PCBs.
Applied high performance thermal paste and mechanically fastened LEDs to ensure optimal heat transfer.
Routed and secured power and signal wiring using heat shrink tubing and cable clips for strain relief.
Tested individual LED channels for correct current delivery and spectrum output before full assembly.
Monitored operating temperatures under continuous duty and adjusted airflow to maintain safe junction temps.
